    • Method Detail

      • indexDocument

        public java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> indexDocument()
                                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Returns:
        docInvIdx - the Set of all the words in the document This function creates a new HashSet based on a document. It indexes every word. The function in this form is used only for creating a set of stop words.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • indexDocument

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String>> indexDocument(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String>> invertedIndex,
                                                                                             java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> stopWords)
                                                                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        invertedIndex - - map of words to add this document to. the keys are the words and the values are a Set of documents.
        stopWords - - set of words NOT to be indexed.
        Returns:
        newInvertedIndex - the inverted index passed in with the document added to the appropriate words. This function uses the Hash Map and Hash Set to instantly access indexes of words. It then checks to see if the word is a stopword. If it is not, then it checks if it is in the index. If the word isn't a stopword and isn't in the index, then it is added to the index. The index is returned after every word in the document has been checked.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • showContents

        public java.lang.String showContents()
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Returns:
        string with the contents of the document this method uses scanner to append each line of the document without changing the contents of the document.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
